p: An indigenous medicinal plant ubiquitous in the Reunion and Mauritius Islands, Psiloxylon mauritianum is widely used in traditional medicine among the local people for dysentery and common infectious diseases [ 113]. Given the high content of polyphenols present in P. mauritianum extract, a study evaluated its ability to inhibit ZIKV and DENV infections [ 113]. The data showed that P. mauritianum extract was able to inhibit ZIKV attachment to the host cell surface, and was able to exert antiviral activity against four DENV serotypes [ 113]. The plant extract displayed low toxicity and did not exert a genotoxic effect on human primary cell lines tested [ 113]. However, more work needs to be done to identify the active compounds responsible for antiviral activity from the plant extract and to investigate its potential to be an anti-flaviviral agent.
